title: Analysis of University Student Satisfaction Changes: Strategy Development Through Innovative Teaching Methods

context.prior_knowledge: Introductory statistics, educational research methodologies, and social science research design
context.additional_context: Learners participate in a project analyzing satisfaction changes using real university education data and developing strategies to improve instructors’ teaching methods. A collaborative learning environment utilizing personal devices (BYOD) is established.

learning_goals: Analyze three years of university educational data to quantitatively explain patterns of change in student satisfaction
Empirically assess the impact of instructors’ pedagogical practices (teaching methods, beliefs, needs) on student satisfaction
Apply a mixture conditional latent growth model to derive cluster-specific characteristics of student satisfaction and propose educational intervention strategies
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
